title: Channel crossings top 1,000 over two days
body:
For free real time breaking news alerts sent straight to your inbox sign up to our breaking news emails Sign up to our free breaking news emails Please enter a valid email address Please enter a valid email address SIGN UP I would like to be emailed about offers, events and updates from The Independent. Read our privacy notice Thanks for signing up to the

Breaking News email {{ #verifyErrors }} {{ message }} {{ /verifyErrors }} {{ ^verifyErrors }} Something went wrong. Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}

More than 1,000 migrants arrived in the UK after crossing the Channel in two days, taking the provisional total for the year so far to over 12,500.

A total of 384 people were detected on Saturday and 686 on Friday – the new highest daily total this year, according to Home Office figures.

It means 1,070 migrants crossed the Channel over two days, in 13 boats on Friday and in seven boats on Saturday, taking the provisional total for the year so far to 12,503.

I think we have got to focus on the fundamentals here. If there are children arriving in the United Kingdom via small boats, then as soon as they land in the UK they are looked after properly Treasury minister Victoria Atkins

The number of people who made the crossing last year reached a record 45,755, prompting Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to make "stopping the boats" a key priority.

Home Secretary Suella Braverman has been battling to get her central policy of forcibly removing unauthorised arrivals to Rwanda off the ground after it was blocked by appeal judges.

The Government has lodged a bid to take its legal battle to the Supreme Court.

Treasury minister Victoria Atkins insisted the Government was focused on the "fundamentals" of looking after children, after being repeatedly asked whether reports that immigration minister Robert Jenrick had cartoon murals at an asylum centre painted over made her feel uncomfortable.

It must be terrifying for children who come across and so that is why we are so focused on stopping the boats. Treasury minister Victoria Atkins

Ms Atkins told the Sophy Ridge On Sunday programme on Sky News: "I think we have got to focus on the fundamentals here. If there are children arriving in the United Kingdom via small boats, then as soon as they land in the UK they are looked after properly.

"The local authorities step in, they have their welfare, their health needs and their schooling needs looked after. That is the fundamentals.

"But we also have to stop people from being enticed by criminal gangs to cross the Channel, because that journey in itself is such a dangerous journey.

"It must be terrifying for children who come across and so that is why we are so focused on stopping the boats."

taxonomy_info.explanation: The article explicitly identifies Victoria Atkins as the Treasury minister and quotes her, confirming both her name and her role.

reasoning.presence_detection: The article explicitly mentions "Treasury minister Victoria Atkins" multiple times, confirming the target entity is present and identified as a Treasury minister.
reasoning.statement_detection: Victoria Atkins is quoted directly: "I think we have got to focus on the fundamentals here…" and is reported to have spoken on the Sky News programme. Thus she is making statements in the article.
reasoning.candidate_evaluation: Candidate 1 (Q19938362) is the only candidate named Victoria Atkins and lists her as a UK politician with a history of Treasury roles (Financial Secretary to the Treasury, etc.). Candidate 2 is a different person with no relevant positions. Therefore Q19938362 best matches the entity referenced in the article.
reasoning.authority_verification: Although the candidate’s most recent Treasury role ended in November 2023, she has held senior Treasury positions and is still a prominent political figure, giving her the authority to speak on Treasury matters.
reasoning.plausibility_assessment: It is plausible for a former Treasury minister to be quoted on immigration and child welfare matters, especially given her political background and the context of the article.
reasoning.final_justification: The entity is present, making statements, and the best matching Wikidata entry is Q19938362. No other candidate fits the description or context.
